lines.text: We are in great danger. It's landed on the beach.
Our arrows will be useless against dragons and they're not at all afraid of fire.
No, Reepicheep, you are not to attempt single combat with it.
[quoting a rhyme a dryad used to sing over his cradle]
Where sky and water meet,/ Where the waves grow sweet/Doubt not, Reepicheep,/ To find all you seek/ There is the utter East.
Your majesty is the mirror of honor.
Are we of Narnia afraid of the dark?
